helpInfo.Info: File operations are accessed under this menu

Branches.Info: Loads a template for authoring templates
Load a specific template

Creates a template from the data in this graph
This only creates a usable template if you are using the basic template

Attempts to load a different template under the current data
Useful for when a template has changed and you want to update your graph

Saves a graph file that contains it's own template and data
This can be easily loaded back up to edit and re-export data
Saves a graph into a new file you specify
Loaded a the template and data stored in a graph file
Clears the data out of a graph, but keeps the current template open

Export data as JSON that leaves out metadata 
Cannot be imported

Export data as JSON
Includes some metadata to allow it to be imported

Attempts to import a JSON into the currently loaded template
Does not  work on JSONs generated outside this tool or Slim jSONs
Opens this help window

Exits the application
If unsaved edits have been detected you will be promted to save

helpInfo.Info:
Menu for editing nodes
Can also be brought up by right clicking

Branches.Info:
A submenu that creates the node selected at the last clicked position
Will be filled with node options based on the loaded template
Copies the selected node and its children

Will attempt to paste copied data at the last clicked postion
This can be used even after changing templates
Deletes the selected node

Select a node
Select a field
Select a box of nodes
Moves all currently highlighted nodes
Toggles the node selected and unselected
Pan view
Open Edit window
Pans the view vertically
Pans the view horizontally
Copy selected node and it's children
Paste selected node and it's children
Delete selected node

helpInfo.Info:
Frequently asked questions, or at least questions I think will be asked
if something behaves oddly it might be explained here
If you have a question not answered here, you can ask
at D.Tom.Norris@gmail.com

Branches.Info:
Engine limitations make currently prevent detecting mulitselect
As a result, multiselect cannot be used for Copy, Paste, or Delete

Currently a NULL saves as an empty object instead of a NULL litteral
If this functionality causes issues I may create another export option for it
